page.title: 02THORNBURY THEN AND NOW 1
page.content: After discussions with Thornbury resident, Miss Pitcher the children of Manorbrook have made the following observations on the changes in Thornbury over the last 80 years. 1. Thornbury named after a giant thorn hedge.It had four boundary streams. 2. Pump on Plain used for cart washing It was dismantled in 1925, and reinstalled 1984 in an improved traffic scheme. 3. Park Road was formerly Gas Works Lane.The Scout hut is on the old site of the Gasworks. 4. Mundy Playing Field used to be The Close. 5. The Chantry used to be Dr Salmon's surgery. Now a Community Centre. 6. Market used to be in Castle St.Now in Rock St on Thurs & Sats. 7. A pint of milk cost 2d. Now 22p. 8. Railway came in 1872. Closed 1924.
